title: VCs Fuel Generative AI Boom with $17.8B Funding Leap
originSummary: Generative AI startups have seen a substantial increase in venture investment, with $17.8 billion raised globally in 2023, compared to $3.9 billion in 2022.
Venture firms are actively raising substantial funds to invest more capital in artificial intelligence, indicating a growing interest in the potential of generative AI.
The significant increase in investment highlights the increasing importance and potential of generative AI technology in various industries.

title: Amazon's "AI Ready" initiative offers free courses and scholarships to boost AI skills training globally.
originSummary: Amazon has launched the "AI Ready" initiative, aiming to offer free AI skills training to 2 million people worldwide by 2025.
An AWS study indicates a high demand for AI talent and the potential for professionals with AI skills to earn up to 47% more in salaries.

The initiative includes eight new and free AI and generative AI courses, scholarships for high school and university students, and a partnership with Code.org to educate students about generative AI. Amazon hopes to make AI education accessible and eliminate cost as a hindrance to acquiring AI skills.

title: AWS re:Invent 2023: 5 Generative AI Announcements & Wishlist
originSummary: AWS is anticipated to announce multiple generative AI advancements at the upcoming AWS re:Invent conference.
Predictions include the introduction of an official AI assistant for cloud operations and a managed vector database for long-term memory.
Other expected announcements include a serverless pipeline for connecting AWS data services, an improved large language model, and enhanced multimodal AI capabilities in Amazon Bedrock.

title: Generative AI: A Game-Changer for Accessible Education or Cause for Concern?
originSummary: 90% of educators believe that AI can improve accessibility in education, but only 15% feel ready to utilize it in the classroom.
Educators have concerns regarding district support and the use of generative AI.

Those who have used generative AI found it helpful in reducing their workload, while others cited lack of familiarity and ethical concerns as barriers. Plagiarism and cheating were also noted as concerns with using generative AI.

title: Navigating Generative AI's Copyright Dilemma: Precautions for Advertisers
originSummary: There is a legal gray area surrounding copyright laws and generative AI tools, with companies having differing opinions on whether using AI to create content based on copyrighted work is fair use.
The U.S. Copyright Office is currently studying this issue, but until a conclusion is reached, marketers are recommended to be cautious to avoid potential copyright claims.
Brands are increasing their spending on TikTok for holiday marketing, showcasing the ongoing evolution of influencer and creator marketing.

title: Master Generative AI with 5 Free Courses
originSummary: The blog post offers a list of five free courses that focus on generative AI, an area that is rapidly advancing in artificial intelligence.
The courses cover a range of topics, including building generative AI applications, working with large language models, and applying generative AI in different contexts.

The post emphasizes the significance of keeping up with the latest developments in this specialized field and encourages learners to gain practical experience by working on projects and creating a portfolio.

title: How Generative AI Streamlines the Data Journey
originSummary: Generative AI has the potential to simplify and make machine data more easily consumable for IT teams.
It can fill knowledge gaps and provide relevant information quickly as the volume of data continues to increase.
It is a promising tool in various industries, such as healthcare and transportation, to make machine-generated data human-readable and valuable.

title: Businesses Prioritize Generative AI & Hybrid Cloud in IBM Study
originSummary: According to an IBM study, 68% of businesses with hybrid cloud use have implemented formal policies for generative AI.
The study emphasizes the significance of sustainability in enterprise tech and the difficulty in finding employees with the necessary cloud skills.

It suggests developing an organization-wide strategy for working with generative AI, addressing cybersecurity concerns, and focusing on desired outcomes. The study also draws parallels between the adoption trends of hybrid cloud and generative AI.
